channel.title: CVE Feed for TCL -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for TCL -- all products

item.title: CVE-2022-24029|2024-09-16T17:48:47.118Z -- tcl -- linkhub%20mesh%20wifi
item.description: A buffer overflow vulnerability exists in the GetValue functionality of TCL LinkHub Mesh Wi-Fi MS1G_00_01.00_14. A specially-crafted configuration value can lead to a buffer overflow. An attacker can modify a configuration value to trigger this vulnerability.This vulnerability represents all occurances of the buffer overflow vulnerability within the rp-pppoe.so binary.

item.title: CVE-2022-24016|2024-09-16T16:54:02.280Z -- tcl -- linkhub%20mesh%20wifi
item.description: A buffer overflow vulnerability exists in the GetValue functionality of TCL LinkHub Mesh Wi-Fi MS1G_00_01.00_14. A specially-crafted configuration value can lead to a buffer overflow. An attacker can modify a configuration value to trigger this vulnerability.This vulnerability represents all occurances of the buffer overflow vulnerability within the mesh_status_check binary.

item.title: CVE-2022-24021|2024-09-16T17:08:41.548Z -- tcl -- linkhub%20mesh%20wifi
item.description: A buffer overflow vulnerability exists in the GetValue functionality of TCL LinkHub Mesh Wi-Fi MS1G_00_01.00_14. A specially-crafted configuration value can lead to a buffer overflow. An attacker can modify a configuration value to trigger this vulnerability.This vulnerability represents all occurances of the buffer overflow vulnerability within the online_process binary.

item.title: CVE-2022-26009|2024-09-16T16:23:34.330Z -- tcl -- linkhub%20mesh%20wifi
item.description: A stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability exists in the confsrv ucloud_set_node_location functionality of TCL LinkHub Mesh Wi-Fi MS1G_00_01.00_14. A specially-crafted network packet can lead to stack-based buffer overflow. An attacker can send a malicious packet to trigger this vulnerability.

item.title: CVE-2022-21201|2024-09-16T17:53:59.036Z -- tcl -- linkhub%20mesh%20wifi
item.description: A stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability exists in the confers ucloud_add_node_new functionality of TCL LinkHub Mesh Wi-Fi MS1G_00_01.00_14. A specially-crafted network packet can lead to stack-based buffer overflow. An attacker can send a malicious packet to trigger this vulnerability.
